metadata.Title: CVE-2022-46908 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.Description:
SQLite through 3.40.0, when relying on --safe for execution of an untrustedCLI script, does not properly implement the azProhibitedFunctionsprotection mechanism, and instead allows UDF functions such as WRITEFILE.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-46908` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lemon - 3.37.2-2ubuntu0.3
libsqlite3-0 - 3.37.2-2ubuntu0.3
libsqlite3-tcl - 3.37.2-2ubuntu0.3
sqlite3 - 3.37.2-2ubuntu0.3
sqlite3-tools - 3.37.2-2ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sqlite3 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.37.2-2ubuntu0.3').
